New Records: India won the match by 8 wickets.
Rohit Sharma scored 52 before retiring hurt.
Jasprit Bumrah was named Player of the Match.
Key Match Events: India won the toss and chose to bowl first.
Ireland's batting collapsed, scoring 96 all out.
Rishabh Pant hit a reverse scoop for the winning six.
Ben White's spin introduction led to quick wickets.
Pre-Game Insights: Captain Rohit Sharma emphasized adapting to conditions.
India aimed for balance in their bowling attack.
Post-Match Reflections: Ireland captain Paul Stirling acknowledged the challenge.
India's fast bowlers dominated the pitch.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was part of the T20 World Cup.
Ireland's next matches include against Canada and USA.
Others: The pitch conditions and weather were noted.
The match was covered by BBC Sport.
